milestones.description: Minhajul Abedin has become the top scorer for BAN in ODIs with 68 runs, going past Shaheedur Rahman's 62
Gazi Ashraf has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (3) for BAN, going past Gholam Nousher
Gazi Ashraf and Athar Ali Khan's 31-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 3rd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 20 between Minhajul Abedin and Gazi Ashraf
Minhajul Abedin and Zahid Razzak's 7-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 6th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 2 between Shaheedur Rahman and Golam Faruq
Jahangir Shah and Nasir Ahmed's 20-run partnership is BAN's highest for the 9th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 5 between Gholam Nousher and Golam Faruq

image.caption: Black clouds hang over the Bangabandhu national stadium in Dhaka
image.longCaption: Black clouds hang over Banghabandhu nation stadium in Dhaka as the pitch is covered with plastic 20 April 2003. South African and India are to play the final match of the TVS tri-nation cricket tournament, but heavy rain stopped the match before it could start
